page.title: 09SANDOWN AIRPORT-1
page.content: Sandown{AIRPORT}is just off the Newport Road on the outskirts of Lake. It is 50 years old this year which means it was built in 1935. It is owned by Evergreen Holdings and part of it is owned by a private company. The airport has one runway which is 1000m. long. Aircraft use the runway in both directions but not at the same time! The airport's area covers 80 acres. The campsite near the airport helps business a lot, because the {TOURISTS} take advantage of the pleasure flights. Sandown airport gets a lot of competition from Bembridge, but Sandown has the edge on Bembridge because of its facilities including a cafe, toilets and hangers. Between 2 and 53 planes land there each day, and 7000-8000 land there each year.
